question_text: Which of the following accurately describe tradeoffs between capacitive and resistive touchscreens? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Capacitive is better for gesture-based interfaces
Resistive allows use with gloves or stylus
Capacitive generally provides sharper display quality
Resistive is more durable under outdoor conditions
Capacitive screens are easier to repair
correct_answer: Capacitive is better for gesture-based interfaces
Resistive allows use with gloves or stylus
Capacitive generally provides sharper display quality
explanation: Capacitive screens offer visual and usability advantages, while resistive screens support broader input types and sometimes lower cost.
